summary: This is an email chain from March 2021 between an FBI Legal Attaché in London and other FBI personnel, forwarding a request to the UK Border Force for historical travel records for Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell from 1994 onward, including travel via private aircraft. It indicates an ongoing investigation into their international movements.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The email requests UK Border Force to search for his historical travel records into and out of the UK from 1994 onward, noting he may have traveled via private aircraft. His passport details are listed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The email requests UK Border Force to search for her historical travel records into and out of the UK from 1994 onward, noting she may have traveled via private aircraft. Multiple passport details (US, UK, France) from various years are provided.

connections.description: Both are named as subjects in the same FBI travel records investigation, with their travel histories being sought jointly from 1994 onward.

events.title: FBI travel records request initiated
events.description: An FBI agent sends a request to another agent to ask UK Border Force for historical travel records for Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell from 1994 onward.

events.title: Request forwarded to UK Border Force
events.description: An FBI Legal Attaché in London forwards the travel records request to the UK Border Force, describing it as a 'high profile case'.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively investigating the international travel history of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell as of March 2021.
The investigation sought travel records from 1994 onward, specifically into and out of the UK, acknowledging travel may have been via private aircraft.
The request was characterized as a 'high profile case' in the email.
Passport details for both individuals, including US, UK, and French passports for Maxwell, were provided to aid the search.
